item.title: Chinese Remainder Theorem
item.description: The Chinese Remainder Theorem (CRT) can help solve systems of equations for modular arithmetic equations. For example, we will use CRT to solve the below problem: $$ x \equiv 2\ (\bmod 3)$$ $$ x \equiv 1\ (\bmod 4)$$ $$ x \equiv 3\ (\bmod 5)$$ With CRT, we can solve this system of equations as if they were three independent equations. Consider the solution for x to be in the following form:
